sentences.english: The one thing a human baby has hard-wired into its system is the ability to cry.
sentences.chinese: 人类婴孩唯一的生存本能就是啼哭。

sentences.english: But did you know that a baby's cry is also a survival mechanism?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你是否知道婴孩的哭啼也是一种生存的本能？

sentences.english: Can a woman forget her sucking child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb?
sentences.chinese: 妇人焉能忘记他吃奶的婴孩，不怜恤他所生的儿子。

sentences.english: But when the pack had puppies, the other adults recruited him to babysit .
sentences.chinese: 但是包让人招募他照看婴孩小狗，其它成年人。

sentences.english: That's because they don't quite know how to hold a baby.
sentences.chinese: 马可说，那是因为他们不知道要怎么抱小婴孩。

sentences.english: The baby loves being tossed up and safely caught.
sentences.chinese: 这小婴孩喜欢人家把他抛起来再稳稳当当地接住。

sentences.english: Then they became less skeptical. His diagnosis on the baby next door did the trick.
sentences.chinese: 而他对隔壁邻居家婴孩的诊断看起来更像是恶作剧了。

sentences.english: You'll have to account to me if anything happen to the baby.
sentences.chinese: 要是婴孩出了什么事，你得对我讲清楚才行。

sentences.english: Pearl was a born outcast of the infantile world.
sentences.chinese: 珠儿生来便是那婴孩天地的弃儿。

sentences.english: The women picked up their babies in the nursery on their any home from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们从工厂回家，顺路到托儿所把要婴孩带回。

sentences.english: I can even up on Mary by looking after her baby at weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我可以在周末照顾玛丽的婴孩，以此来报答她。

sentences.english: An imp of evil, emblem and product of sin, she had no right among christened infants.
sentences.chinese: 是罪孽的标志和产物，无挤身于受洗的婴孩之列。

sentences.english: The mother stared at her dead baby with tearless grief.
sentences.chinese: 母亲带着欲哭无泪的悲哀凝视着她死去的婴孩。

sentences.english: Babies that are 6 month old can be fed with rice porridge or congee containing bird's nest.
sentences.chinese: 六个月大的婴孩能用含燕窝的米粥或粥。

sentences.english: At first the infant, Mewling and puking in the nurse's arms.
sentences.chinese: 最初是婴孩，在保姆的怀中啼哭呕吐。

definition: swaddling clothes/fig. early stage of development/infancy
to be born/arrival of newborn/birth (of a savior or religious leader)
El Niño (meteorology)/Holy Infant (cf biblical nativity story)
